takeaway.headline: Teach baseline AI literacy for all students, then add role-based depth.
takeaway.subhead: Job postings show AI skills spreading beyond tech roles, and the most valuable skills differ by job family (power-user vs builder vs high-stakes governance).

coreSkills.title: AI literacy & judgment
coreSkills.desc: Limits, failure modes, verification habits, and when not to use AI.

coreSkills.title: Prompting + iteration
coreSkills.desc: Clear constraints, examples, critique loops, and evaluation criteria.

coreSkills.title: Data literacy
coreSkills.desc: Data quality, privacy basics, measurement, and experimentation mindset.

coreSkills.title: Responsible AI
coreSkills.desc: Bias, privacy/security, transparency, and human oversight.

coreSkills.title: Human skills amplified by AI
coreSkills.desc: Problem framing, communication, domain context, ethical reasoning.

aiMentionsTrend.title: AI mentions in job postings are rising (Indeed AI Tracker)
aiMentionsTrend.note: Keep these as placeholders until you replace them with exact points from the Indeed AI Tracker chart. The anchor point is 4.2% in Dec 2025.

aiMentionsByFamily.title: AI mentions differ by job family (Dec 2025)
aiMentionsByFamily.note: From Indeed Hiring Lab’s Jan 22, 2026 labor market update.

aiOutsideITShare.title: AI demand extends beyond IT/CS (2024)
aiOutsideITShare.note: From Lightcast reporting: share of postings requiring AI skills outside IT/CS (as of 2024).

Non-technical: Data-informed decision making and impact measurement
Technical: LLM integration patterns (RAG, tool use, evaluation)
Monitoring and lifecycle (drift, feedback, incident response)

sources.name: Indeed Hiring Lab — Jan 2026 Labor Market Update (AI Tracker 4.2% in Dec 2025; 45% data & analytics; ~15% marketing; ~9% HR)
Indeed Career Advice — AI in job postings (context + trend discussion, updated Jan 2026)
Lightcast — AI skills outside IT/CS (press release summary)
